026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.tool;
027
028import java.util.ArrayList;
029import java.util.Arrays;
030import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
031import java.util.List;
032import java.util.Map;
033import javax.lang.model.element.ElementKind;
034
035import com.sun.tools.javac.main.Option;
036import com.sun.tools.javac.main.Option.InvalidValueException;
037import com.sun.tools.javac.main.OptionHelper;
038import com.sun.tools.javac.util.Context;
039import com.sun.tools.javac.util.Options;
040
041import static org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.tool.Main.Result.OK;
042import static org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.tool.ToolOptions.ToolOption.Kind.*;
043
044/**
045 * Storage and support for javadoc tool options, as distinct from
046 * the options supported by any doclet that may be in use.
047 * The tool options includes those options which are delegated
048 * to javac and/or the file manager, such as options to set
049 * the source level, and path options to locate the files to be
050 * documented.
051 *
052 * <p>Some of the methods used to access the values of options
053 * have names that begin with a verb, such as {@link #expandRequires}
054 * or {@link #ignoreSourceErrors}. Unless otherwise stated,
055 * these methods should all be taken as just accessing the value
056 * of the associated option.
057 */
058public class ToolOptions {
059    // The following are the names of options handled in the first pass of
060    // option decoding,
061    // in Start.preprocess.
062    static final String DOCLET = "-doclet";
063    static final String DOCLET_PATH = "-docletpath";
064    static final String DUMP_ON_ERROR = "--dump-on-error";
065    static final String AT = "@";
066    static final String J = "-J";
067    static final String LOCALE = "-locale";
068
069    /**
070     * Argument for command-line option {@code -breakiterator}.
071     */
072    private boolean breakIterator = false;
073
074    /**
075     * Argument for command-line option {@code --dump-on-error}.
076     * Dump stack traces for debugging etc.
077     * Similar to javac {@code -doe}.
078     */
079    private boolean dumpOnError = false;
080
081    /**
082     * Argument for command-line option {@code -exclude}.
083     */
084    private List<String> excludes = new ArrayList<>();
085
086    /**
087     * Argument for command-line option {@code --expand-requires}.
088     */
089    private AccessKind expandRequires;
090
091    /**
092     * Argument for command-line option {@code --ignore-source-errors}.
093     */
094    private boolean ignoreSourceErrors;
095
096    /**
097     * Argument for command-line option {@code --module}.
098     */
099    private List<String> modules = new ArrayList<>();
100
101    /**
102     * Argument for command-line option {@code -Werror}.
103     * Set by -Werror.
104     */
105    private boolean rejectWarnings = false;
106
107    /**
108     * Argument for command-line option {@code --show-members}.
109     */
110    private AccessKind showMembersAccess;
111
112    /**
113     * Argument for command-line option {@code --show-types}.
114     */
115    private AccessKind showTypesAccess;
116
117    /**
118     * Argument for command-line option {@code --show-packages}.
119     */
120    private AccessKind showPackagesAccess;
121
122    /**
123     * Argument for command-line option {@code --show-module-contents}.
124     */
125    private AccessKind showModuleContents;
126
127    /**
128     * Argument for command-line option {@code -quiet}.
129     */
130    private boolean quiet;
131
132    /**
133     * Argument for command-line option {@code -subpackages}.
134     */
135    private List<String> subpackages = new ArrayList<>();
136
137    /**
138     * Argument for command-line option {@code -verbose}.
139     */
140    private boolean verbose;
141
142    /**
143     * Argument for command-line option {@code -Xclasses}.
144     * If true, names on the command line that would normally be
145     * treated as package names are treated as class names instead.
146     */
147    private boolean xclasses = false;
148
149    /**
150     * Options to be given to the file manager, such as path options
151     * indicating where to find files to be documented.
152     */
153    private final Map<Option, String> fileManagerOpts;
154
155    /**
156     * Options to be given to the underlying compiler front-end,
157     * such as options to indicate the source level to be used.
158     */
159    private final Options compOpts;
160
161    /**
162     * The "helper" to be used when processing compiler options.
163     */
164    private final OptionHelper compilerOptionHelper;
165
166    /**
167     * The log to be used to report diagnostics..
168     */
169    private final JavadocLog log;
170
171    /**
172     * The helper for help and version options
173     */
174    private final ShowHelper showHelper;
175
176    /**
177     * Creates an object to handle tool options.
178     *
179     * @param context the context used to find other tool-related components
180     * @param log the log to be used to report diagnostics
181     */
182    ToolOptions(Context context, JavadocLog log, ShowHelper showHelper) {
183        this.log = log;
184        this.showHelper = showHelper;
185        compOpts = Options.instance(context);
186        fileManagerOpts = new LinkedHashMap<>();
187        compilerOptionHelper = getOptionHelper();
188        setAccessDefault();
189    }
190
191    /**
192     * Creates a minimal object, just sufficient to check the names of the
193     * supported options.
194     */
195    private ToolOptions() {
196        compOpts = null;
197        compilerOptionHelper = null;
198        fileManagerOpts = null;
199        log = null;
200        showHelper = null;
201    }
202
203    /**
204     * Returns the set of options supported by the tool, excluding any options
205     * that are managed by the doclet that may be in use.
206     *
207     * @return the set of options
208     */
209    public List<ToolOption> getSupportedOptions() {
210        return supportedOptions;
211    }
212
213    /**
214     * Determines if the given option is supported and if so, the
215     * number of arguments the option takes.
216     *
217     * @param option an option
218     * @return the number of arguments the given option takes or -1 if
219     * the option is not supported
220     * @see javax.tools.DocumentationTool#isSupportedOption(String)
221     */
222    public static int isSupportedOption(String option) {
223        ToolOptions t = new ToolOptions();
224        for (ToolOption o : t.supportedOptions) {
225            for (String name : o.names) {
226                if (name.equals(option))
227                    return o.hasArg ? 1 : 0;
228            }
229        }
230        return -1;
231    }
232
233    /**
234     * Returns the option to be used to process an argument such as may be found on
235     * the command line.
236     *
237     * @param arg the argument
238     * @return the option
239     */
240    ToolOption getOption(String arg) {
241        String name = arg;
242        if (arg.startsWith("--") && arg.contains("=")) {
243            name = arg.substring(0, arg.indexOf('='));
244        }
245        for (ToolOption o : supportedOptions) {
246            for (String n : o.names) {
247                if (name.equals(n)) {
248                    return o;
249                }
250            }
251        }
252        return null;
253    }
254
255    private List<ToolOption> supportedOptions = List.of(
256        // ----- options for underlying compiler -----
257
258        new ToolOption("-bootclasspath", STANDARD, true) {
259            @Override
260            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
261                processCompilerOption(Option.BOOT_CLASS_PATH, primaryName, arg);
262            }
263        },
264
265        new ToolOption("--class-path -classpath -cp", STANDARD, true) {
266            @Override
267            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
268                processCompilerOption(Option.CLASS_PATH, primaryName, arg);
269            }
270        },
271
272        new ToolOption("-extdirs", STANDARD, true) {
273            @Override
274            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
275                processCompilerOption(Option.EXTDIRS, primaryName, arg);
276            }
277        },
278
279        new ToolOption("--source-path -sourcepath", STANDARD, true) {
280            @Override
281            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
282                processCompilerOption(Option.SOURCE_PATH, primaryName, arg);
283            }
284        },
285
286        new ToolOption("--module-source-path", STANDARD, true) {
287            @Override
288            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
289                processCompilerOption(Option.MODULE_SOURCE_PATH, primaryName,
290                    arg);
291            }
292        },
293
294        new ToolOption("--upgrade-module-path", STANDARD, true) {
295            @Override
296            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
297                processCompilerOption(Option.UPGRADE_MODULE_PATH, primaryName,
298                    arg);
299            }
300        },
301
302        new ToolOption("--system", STANDARD, true) {
303            @Override
304            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
305                processCompilerOption(Option.SYSTEM, primaryName, arg);
306            }
307        },
308
309        new ToolOption("--module-path -p", STANDARD, true) {
310            @Override
311            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
312                processCompilerOption(Option.MODULE_PATH, primaryName, arg);
313            }
314        },
315
316        new ToolOption("--add-modules", STANDARD, true) {
317            @Override
318            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
319                processCompilerOption(Option.ADD_MODULES, primaryName, arg);
320            }
321        },
322
323        new ToolOption("--limit-modules", STANDARD, true) {
324            @Override
325            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
326                processCompilerOption(Option.LIMIT_MODULES, primaryName, arg);
327            }
328        },
329
330        new ToolOption("--module", STANDARD, true) {
331            @Override
332            public void process(String arg) {
333                modules.addAll(List.of(arg.split(",")));
334            }
335        },
336
337        new ToolOption("-encoding", STANDARD, true) {
338            @Override
339            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
340                processCompilerOption(Option.ENCODING, primaryName, arg);
341            }
342        },
343
344        new ToolOption("--release", STANDARD, true) {
345            @Override
346            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
347                processCompilerOption(Option.RELEASE, primaryName, arg);
348            }
349        },
350
351        new ToolOption("--source -source", STANDARD, true) {
352            @Override
353            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
354                processCompilerOption(Option.SOURCE, primaryName, arg);
355                processCompilerOption(Option.TARGET, Option.TARGET.primaryName,
356                    arg);
357            }
358        },
359
360        new ToolOption("-Xmaxerrs", EXTENDED, true) {
361            @Override
362            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
363                processCompilerOption(Option.XMAXERRS, primaryName, arg);
364            }
365        },
366
367        new ToolOption("-Xmaxwarns", EXTENDED, true) {
368            @Override
369            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
370                processCompilerOption(Option.XMAXWARNS, primaryName, arg);
371            }
372        },
373
374        new ToolOption("--add-reads", EXTENDED, true) {
375            @Override
376            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
377                processCompilerOption(Option.ADD_READS, primaryName, arg);
378            }
379        },
380
381        new ToolOption("--add-exports", EXTENDED, true) {
382            @Override
383            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
384                processCompilerOption(Option.ADD_EXPORTS, primaryName, arg);
385            }
386        },
387
388        new ToolOption("--patch-module", EXTENDED, true) {
389            @Override
390            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
391                processCompilerOption(Option.PATCH_MODULE, primaryName, arg);
392            }
393        },
394

396            @Override
397            public void process(String arg) throws InvalidValueException {
398                processCompilerOption(Option.ADD_OPENS, primaryName, arg);
399            }
400        },

404            public void process() throws InvalidValueException {
405                processCompilerOption(Option.PREVIEW, primaryName);
406            }

412        // It is implemented in {@link Start#preprocess}.

416        // It is implemented in {@link Start#preprocess}.

420

423            public void process(String arg) {
424                subpackages.addAll(List.of(arg.split(":")));
425            }
426        },

429            @Override
430            public void process(String arg) {
431                excludes.addAll(List.of(arg.split(":")));
432            }
433        },
434

436
437        new ToolOption("-package", STANDARD) {
438            @Override
439            public void process() throws OptionException {
440                setSimpleFilter("package");
441            }
442        },
443
444        new ToolOption("-private", STANDARD) {
445            @Override
446            public void process() throws OptionException {
447                setSimpleFilter("private");
448            }
449        },
450
451        new ToolOption("-protected", STANDARD) {
452            @Override
453            public void process() throws OptionException {
454                setSimpleFilter("protected");
455            }
456        },
457
458        new ToolOption("-public", STANDARD) {
459            @Override
460            public void process() throws OptionException {
461                setSimpleFilter("public");
462            }
463        },
464
465        new ToolOption("--show-members", STANDARD, true) {
466            @Override
467            public void process(String arg) throws OptionException {
468                setShowMembersAccess(arg);
469            }
470        },
471
472        new ToolOption("--show-types", STANDARD, true) {
473            @Override
474            public void process(String arg) throws OptionException {
475                setShowTypesAccess(arg);
476            }
477        },

480            @Override
481            public void process(String arg) throws OptionException {
482                setShowPackageAccess(arg);
483            }
484        },
485
486        new ToolOption("--show-module-contents", STANDARD, true) {
487            @Override
488            public void process(String arg) throws OptionException {
489                setShowModuleContents(arg);
490            }
491        },
492
493        new ToolOption("--expand-requires", STANDARD, true) {
494            @Override
495            public void process(String arg) throws OptionException {
496                setExpandRequires(arg);
497            }
498        },
499
500        // ----- output control options -----
501
502        new ToolOption("-quiet", STANDARD) {
503            @Override
504            public void process() {
505                quiet = true;
506            }
507        },
508
509        new ToolOption("-verbose", STANDARD) {
510            @Override
511            public void process() {
512                setVerbose();
513            }
514        },
515
516        // superseded by -Werror, retained for a while for compatibility,
517        // although note that it is an undocumented hidden option, and can
518        // be removed without warning
519        new ToolOption("-Xwerror", HIDDEN) {
520            @Override
521            public void process() {
522                rejectWarnings = true;
523            }
524        },
525
526        new ToolOption("-Werror", STANDARD) {
527            @Override
528            public void process() {
529                rejectWarnings = true;
530            }
531        },
532
533        // ----- other options -----
534
535        new ToolOption("-breakiterator", STANDARD) {
536            @Override
537            public void process() {
538                breakIterator = true;
539            }
540        },
541
542        // This option exists so that it is documented in the command-line help.
543        // It is implemented in {@link Start#preprocess}.
544        new ToolOption(LOCALE, STANDARD, true),
545
546        new ToolOption("-Xclasses", HIDDEN) {
547            @Override
548            public void process() {
549                xclasses = true;
550            }
551        },
552
553        // This option exists so that it is documented in the command-line help.
554        // It is implemented in {@link Start#preprocess}.
555        new ToolOption(DUMP_ON_ERROR, HIDDEN),
556
557        new ToolOption("--ignore-source-errors", HIDDEN) {
558            @Override
559            public void process() {
560                ignoreSourceErrors = true;
561            }
562        },
563
564        // ----- help options -----
565
566        new ToolOption("--help -help -? -h", STANDARD) {
567            @Override
568            public void process() throws OptionException {
569                throw new OptionException(OK, showHelper::usage);
570            }
571        },
572
573        new ToolOption("--help-extra -X", STANDARD) {
574            @Override
575            public void process() throws OptionException {
576                throw new OptionException(OK, showHelper::Xusage);
577            }
578        },
579
580        // This option exists so that it is documented in the command-line help.
581        // It is actually implemented by the launcher, and can only be used when
582        // invoking javadoc from the launcher.
583        new ToolOption(J, STANDARD, true) {
584            @Override
585            public void process() {
586                throw new AssertionError(
587                    "the -J flag should be caught by the launcher.");
588            }
589        },
590
591        // This option exists so that it is documented in the command-line help.
592        // It is actually implemented by expanding argv early on during
593        // execution,
594        // and can only be used when using the command-line and related
595        // interfaces
596        // (i.e. not the javax.tools API).
597        new ToolOption(AT, STANDARD, true) {
598            @Override
599            public void process() {
600                throw new AssertionError("the @ option is handled separately");
601            }
602        },
603
604        new ToolOption("--version", STANDARD) {
605            @Override
606            public void process() throws OptionException {
607                throw new OptionException(OK, showHelper::version);
608            }
609        },
610
611        new ToolOption("--full-version", HIDDEN) {
612            @Override
613            public void process() throws OptionException {
614                throw new OptionException(OK, showHelper::fullVersion);
615            }
616        });
617
618    /**
619     * Base class for all supported tool options.
620     */
621    static class ToolOption {
622        enum Kind {
623            STANDARD, EXTENDED, HIDDEN
624        }
625
626        final String primaryName;
627        final List<String> names;
628        final Kind kind;
629        final boolean hasArg;
630        final boolean hasSuffix; // ex: foo:bar or -foo=bar
631
632        ToolOption(String opt, Kind kind) {
633            this(opt, kind, false);
634        }
635
636        ToolOption(String names, Kind kind, boolean hasArg) {
637            this.names = Arrays.asList(names.split("\\s+"));
638            this.primaryName = this.names.get(0);
639            this.kind = kind;
640            this.hasArg = hasArg;
641            char lastChar = names.charAt(names.length() - 1);
642            this.hasSuffix = lastChar == ':' || lastChar == '=';
643        }
644
645        void process(String arg)
646                throws OptionException, Option.InvalidValueException {
647        }
648
649        void process() throws OptionException, Option.InvalidValueException {
650        }
651
652        List<String> getNames() {
653            return names;
654        }
655
656        String getParameters(JavadocLog log) {
657            return (hasArg || primaryName.endsWith(":"))
658                ? log.getText(getKey(primaryName, ".arg"))
659                : null;
660        }
661
662        String getDescription(JavadocLog log) {
663            return log.getText(getKey(primaryName, ".desc"));
664        }
665
666        private String getKey(String optionName, String suffix) {
667            return "main.opt."
668                + optionName
669                    .replaceAll("^-*", "")              // remove leading '-'
670                    .replaceAll("^@", "at")             // handle '@'
671                    .replaceAll("[^A-Za-z0-9]+$", "")   // remove trailing
672                                                        // non-alphanumeric
673                    .replaceAll("[^A-Za-z0-9]", ".")    // replace internal
674                                                        // non-alphanumeric
675                + suffix;
676        }
677    }
678
679    interface ShowHelper {
680        /**
681         * Show command-line help for the standard options, as requested by
682         * the {@code --help} option and its aliases.
683         */
684        void usage();
685
686        /**
687         * Show command-line help for the extended options, as requested by
688         * the {@code --help-extended} option and its aliases.
689         */
690        void Xusage();
691
692        /**
693         * Show the basic version information, as requested by the {@code --version} option.
694         */
695        void version();
696
697        /**
698         * Show the full version information, as requested by the {@code --full-version} option.
699         */
700        void fullVersion();
701    }
702
703    // <editor-fold desc="accessor methods">
704    /**
705     * Argument for command-line option {@code -breakiterator}.
706     */
707    boolean breakIterator() {
708        return breakIterator;
709    }
710
711    /**
712     * Argument for command-line option {@code --dump-on-error}.
713     * Dump stack traces for debugging etc.
714     * Similar to javac {@code -doe}.
715     */
716    boolean dumpOnError() {
717        return dumpOnError;
718    }
719
720    void setDumpOnError(boolean v) {
721        dumpOnError = v;
722    }
723
724    /**
725     * Argument for command-line option {@code -exclude}.
726     */
727    List<String> excludes() {
728        return excludes;
729    }
730
731    /**
732     * Argument for command-line option {@code --expand-requires}.
733     */
734    AccessKind expandRequires() {
735        return expandRequires;
736    }
737
738    /**
739     * Argument for command-line option {@code --ignore-source-errors}.
740     */
741    boolean ignoreSourceErrors() {
742        return ignoreSourceErrors;
743    }
744
745    /**
746     * Argument for command-line option {@code --module}.
747     */
748    List<String> modules() {
749        return modules;
750    }
751
752    /**
753     * Argument for command-line option {@code -Werror}.
754     * Set by -Werror.
755     */
756    boolean rejectWarnings() {
757        return rejectWarnings;
758    }
759
760    /**
761     * Argument for command-line option {@code --show-members}.
762     */
763    AccessKind showMembersAccess() {
764        return showMembersAccess;
765    }
766
767    /**
768     * Argument for command-line option {@code --show-types}.
769     */
770    AccessKind showTypesAccess() {
771        return showTypesAccess;
772    }
773
774    /**
775     * Argument for command-line option {@code --show-packages}.
776     */
777    AccessKind showPackagesAccess() {
778        return showPackagesAccess;
779    }
780
781    /**
782     * Argument for command-line option {@code --show-module-contents}.
783     */
784    AccessKind showModuleContents() {
785        return showModuleContents;
786    }
787
788    /**
789     * Argument for command-line option {@code -quiet}.
790     */
791    boolean quiet() {
792        return quiet;
793    }
794
795    /**
796     * Argument for command-line option {@code -subpackages}.
797     */
798    List<String> subpackages() {
799        return subpackages;
800    }
801
802    /**
803     * Argument for command-line option {@code -verbose}.
804     */
805    boolean verbose() {
806        return verbose;
807    }
808
809    /**
810     * Argument for command-line option {@code -Xclasses}.
811     * If true, names on the command line that would normally be
812     * treated as package names are treated as class names instead.
813     */
814    boolean xclasses() {
815        return xclasses;
816    }
817
818    /**
819     * Returns the set of options to be used for the instance of the
820     * underlying compiler front-end.
821     *
822     * @return the options
823     */
824    Options compilerOptions() {
825        return compOpts;
826    }
827
828    /**
829     * Returns the set of options to be used for the file manager.
830     *
831     * @return the options
832     */
833    Map<Option, String> fileManagerOptions() {
834        return fileManagerOpts;
835    }
836    // </editor-fold>
837
838    /**
839     * Returns an {@code IllegalOptionValue} exception.
840     *
841     * @param arg the argument to include in the detail message
842     * @return the exception
843     */
844    private IllegalOptionValue illegalOptionValue(String arg) {
845        return new IllegalOptionValue(showHelper::usage,
846            log.getText("main.illegal_option_value", arg));
847    }
848
849    /**
850     * Process a compiler option.
851     *
852     * @param option the option object to process the command-line option
853     * @param opt    the command-line option
854     * @throws Option.InvalidValueException if the command-line option is invalid
855     */
856    void processCompilerOption(Option option, String opt)
857            throws Option.InvalidValueException {
858        option.process(compilerOptionHelper, opt);
859    }
860
861    /**
862     * Process a compiler option.
863     *
864     * @param option the option object to process the command-line option
865     * @param opt    the command-line option
866     * @param arg    the argument for the command-line option
867     * @throws Option.InvalidValueException if the command-line option is invalid
868     */
869    private void processCompilerOption(Option option, String opt, String arg)
870            throws Option.InvalidValueException {
871        option.process(compilerOptionHelper, opt, arg);
872    }
873
874    /**
875     * Returns a "helper" to be used when processing compiler options.
876     * @return the helper
877     */
878    private OptionHelper getOptionHelper() {
879        return new OptionHelper.GrumpyHelper(log) {
880            @Override
881            public String get(com.sun.tools.javac.main.Option option) {
882                return compOpts.get(option);
883            }
884
885            @Override
886            public void put(String name, String value) {
887                compOpts.put(name, value);
888            }
889
890            @Override
891            public void remove(String name) {
892                compOpts.remove(name);
893            }
894
895            @Override
896            public boolean handleFileManagerOption(
897                    com.sun.tools.javac.main.Option option, String value) {
898                fileManagerOpts.put(option, value);
899                return true;
900            }
901        };
902    }
903
904    private void setExpandRequires(String arg) throws OptionException {
905        switch (arg) {
906        case "transitive":
907            expandRequires = AccessKind.PUBLIC;
908            break;
909        case "all":
910            expandRequires = AccessKind.PRIVATE;
911            break;
912        default:
913            throw illegalOptionValue(arg);
914        }
915    }
916
917    private void setShowModuleContents(String arg) throws OptionException {
918        switch (arg) {
919        case "api":
920            showModuleContents = AccessKind.PUBLIC;
921            break;
922        case "all":
923            showModuleContents = AccessKind.PRIVATE;
924            break;
925        default:
926            throw illegalOptionValue(arg);
927        }
928    }
929
930    private void setShowPackageAccess(String arg) throws OptionException {
931        switch (arg) {
932        case "exported":
933            showPackagesAccess = AccessKind.PUBLIC;
934            break;
935        case "all":
936            showPackagesAccess = AccessKind.PRIVATE;
937            break;
938        default:
939            throw illegalOptionValue(arg);
940        }
941    }
942
943    private void setShowTypesAccess(String arg) throws OptionException {
944        showTypesAccess = getAccessValue(arg);
945    }
946
947    private void setShowMembersAccess(String arg) throws OptionException {
948        showMembersAccess = getAccessValue(arg);
949    }
950
951    private void setSimpleFilter(String arg) throws OptionException {
952        setSimpleAccessOption(arg);
953    }
954
955    private void setVerbose() {
956        compOpts.put("-verbose", "");
957        verbose = true;
958    }
959
960    private void setSimpleAccessOption(String arg) throws OptionException {
961        setAccess(getAccessValue(arg));
962    }
963
964    /*
965     * This method handles both the simple options -package,
966     * -private, so on, in addition to the new ones such as
967     * --show-types:public and so on.
968     */
969    private AccessKind getAccessValue(String arg) throws OptionException {
970        int colon = arg.indexOf(':');
971        String value = (colon > 0)
972            ? arg.substring(colon + 1)
973            : arg;
974        switch (value) {
975        case "public":
976            return AccessKind.PUBLIC;
977        case "protected":
978            return AccessKind.PROTECTED;
979        case "package":
980            return AccessKind.PACKAGE;
981        case "private":
982            return AccessKind.PRIVATE;
983        default:
984            throw illegalOptionValue(value);
985        }
986    }
987
988    /*
989     * Sets all access members to PROTECTED; this is the default.
990     */
991    private void setAccessDefault() {
992        setAccess(AccessKind.PROTECTED);
993    }
994
995    /*
996     * This sets access to all the allowed kinds in the
997     * access members.
998     */
999    private void setAccess(AccessKind accessValue) {
1000        for (ElementKind kind : ElementsTable.ModifierFilter.ALLOWED_KINDS) {
1001            switch (kind) {
1002            case METHOD:
1003                showMembersAccess = accessValue;
1004                break;
1005            case CLASS:
1006                showTypesAccess = accessValue;
1007                break;
1008            case PACKAGE:
1009                showPackagesAccess = accessValue;
1010                break;
1011            case MODULE:
1012                showModuleContents = accessValue;
1013                break;
1014            default:
1015                throw new AssertionError("unknown element kind:" + kind);
1016            }
1017        }
1018    }
1019}
